citeinfo.origin: United States. Bureau of Transportation Statistics
citeinfo.title: United States National Bridge Inventory, 2013

citeinfo.origin: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)
citeinfo.title: National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2013

pubinfo.publish: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

descript.abstract: The NBI is a collection of information (database) describing the more than 600,000 of the Nation's bridges located on public roads, including Interstate Highways, U.S. highways, State and county roads, as well as publicly-accessible bridges on Federal lands. It presents a State by State summary analysis of the number, location, and general condition of highway bridges within each State.
descript.purpose: To document the nation's bridge inventory.

cntinfo.cntinst: Federal Highway Administration 1200 New Jersey Ave., SE Washington, DC 20590

cntorgp.cntorg: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.0.3035

citeinfo.origin: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)
citeinfo.title: National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2013

pubinfo.publish: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

dataqual.logic: RITA/BTS quality checks were to cross reference the NBI dataset with an up-to-date TeleAtlas dataset, to determine that the spatial data and attribute data were accurate. For those bridges that were not matched to the TeleAtlas data, an attempt was made to use the State supplied longitude-latitude data contained in the NBI. If the resulting point fell within the State, then that location was used. If the point fell outside of the State, it is coded to longitude-latitude 0-0. See the STATUS attribute for more information.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

edom.edomvd: Bridge was automatically conflated to the TeleAtlas Road Network
Bridge was manually matched to the TeleAtlas Road Network
State Supplied Coordinates were used. Not guaranteed to match any road network.
Bridge could not be located and is mapped to longitude-latitude 0-0.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

stdorder.ordering: Call (202-366-DATA), fax (202-366-3640), or E-mail (answers@bts.gov) RITA/BTS to request the National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2013 DVD. The NTAD DVD can be ordered from the online bookstore at www.bts.gov. Individual datasets from the NTAD can also be downloaded from the Office of Geospatial Information Systems website at http://www.bts.gov/programs/geographic_information_services/

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
